SecurityClient package¶

Submodules¶

SecurityClient.SecurityClient module¶

class SecurityClient.SecurityClient.SecurityClient(serverPublicKeyPath)¶

Bases: object

AESDecryptText(cipherText, username=None, serverCommunication=None)¶

Decrypt the passed cipherText with AES, if the serverCommunication is not None, then uses the symmetricKey to send a message to the server, if there is a specified username then it uses the nonce of the client because the message is been received from the server for the Online Key Exchange Protocol, else it uses the nonce with the server. If there is a specified nonce then it uses the symmetricKey of the client passed as username and the nonce passed

Parameters:
  • cipherText (Bytes) – the cipher text that must be decrypted
  • username (String or None) – None if we have to use the symmetric key of the server
  • serverCommunication (Int or None) – specify if the message will go to the server or to a client
AESEncryptText(plainText, user=None)¶

Encrypt the plain text passed using AES Galois Counter Mode. The nonce used is, if the username is None, the one of the server, else is the associated nonce with the user passed as parameter; the nonce is incremented every time in order to not use more than one time one the same value for the nonce.

Parameters:
  • plainText (Bytes) – the text that must be encrypted
  • user (String or None) – Specify which nonce must be used
Return type:

Bytes
Returns:

The encrypted message
AddServerSymmetricKey(key)¶

Add the symmetric key for the conversation with the server :type key: Int :param key: the symmetric key

RSADecryptText(cipherText)¶

Perform the decryption of the passed cipherText with the private key of the client

Parameters:cipherText (Bytes) – The cipher text
Return type:Bytes
Returns:The plain text
RSAEncryptText(text, key)¶

Encrypt the text passed with the passed key

Parameters:
  • text (Bytes) – the text that must be encrypted
  • key (Bytes) – the key that must be used for encrypt with RSA
Return type:

Bytes
Returns:

the encrypted text
VerifySignature(text, signature, user=None)¶

Performs the validation of the passed signature on the passed text using the public key of the server if the user is None, else uses the public key of the passed user

Parameters:
  • text (Bytes) – the text to check the signature
  • signature (Bytes) – the signature that must be verify
  • user (String or None) – The username of the user that had signed the text, if it’s None the signature is of the server
Return type:

Boolean
Returns:

True if the signature is valide, else False
addClientNonce(user, nonce)¶

Used to add the passed nonce to a dictionary indexed with the corrispective user

Parameters:
  • user (String) – the username correlated to that specific nonce
  • nonce (Int) – the nonce used for the conversation with user
computeDHKey(user, sharedKey, mine)¶

Generates the symmetric key for the conversation with the user, if mine is None this means that the parameters diffie-hellman used have been generated by the specified user, otherwise they are mine

Parameters:
  • user (String) – user with which the conversation is active
  • sharedKey (Bytes) – the public value sent by the user to complete the protocol
  • mine (Boolean) – Specified who has created the public parameters for diffie hellman
decryptServerMessage(cipherText)¶

Handles the decryption of the messages received from the Server, if the symmetric key with the server does not exist then uses RSA else AES is used

Parameters:cipherText (Bytes) – The text that must decrypted
Return type:Bytes or None
Returns:The plain text or, if the signature is not valid, None
generateDH(p, g, user)¶

Generates a structure used for the Diffie-Hellman protcol, in paricular it is generate the unknown random value used to create the public value that must be sent to other peers and to compute the shared key, user specifies who is the owner of the parameters g and p

Parameters:
  • p (Int) – parameter p of diffie-hellman
  • g (Int) – parameter g of diffie-hellman
  • user (String) – the owner of p and g
generateDHParameters()¶

Generates the public parameters g and p for the diffie-hellman protocol :rtype: List<Int> :return: g and p in a list

generateNonce(size)¶

Generate a nonce of a dimension chosed (in bytes) a get it as an Integer encoded in Big Endian

Parameters:size (Int) – The size (in Bytes) of the nonce
Return type:Int
Returns:A nonce generated using the system call specific for cryptography purpose of the dimensione passed as argument
generate_key()¶

Creates the private key for the client

getClientNonce(user)¶

obtain the nonce correlated with the passed user

Parameters:user (String) – used to obtain the correlated nonce
Return type:Int
Returns:nonce of the conversation with user
getDigest(text)¶

Apply the hash to the text passed

Parameters:text (Bytes) – the text
Return type:Bytes
Returns:The digest
getKeyClient(user)¶

obtain the public key of the passed user

Parameters:user (String) – the owner of the public key required
Return type:Bytes
Returns:the public key of user

Return type:Bytes

Used to get the shared key used in the conversation with the passed user

Parameters:user (String) – the username
Return type:Bytes
Returns:the shared symmetric key with the user

Sign the passed text with the private key of the client

Parameters:text (Bytes) – The text that must be signed
Return type:Bytes
Returns:the signature
getSymmetricKey()¶

obtain the symmetricKey of the conversation with the server

Return type:Bytes

initializeSecurity(path, username)¶

Loads the private key of the user that is performing the login, using the path and the username passed as argument

Parameters:
  • path (String) – The path of the pem file where the private key of the user is
  • username (String) – The username of the user that is trying to login
Return type:

Boolean
Returns:

True if the key is loaded Succesfully, False if there is some problem
insertKeyClient(user, publicKey)¶

insert the public key of the user passed as parameter

Parameters:
  • user (String) – the owner of the public key
  • publicKey (Bytes) – the public key of the user
isSymmetricKeyClientPresent(user)¶

Check if exists a symmetric key for the conversation with the passed user

Parameters:user (String) – the user relative to the symmetric key
Return type:Boolean
Returns:True if the symmetric key is present, False otherwise
loadDHParameters(path)¶

Loads the diffie-hellman parameters g and p from the json file specified by path and starts the instance of the structure used to perform the diffie-hellman protocol

Parameters:path (String) – Path for the json file
Return type:Boolean
Returns:True if correctly loaded, False otherwise
resetKeys()¶

Reset all the keys and nonce stored

resetSymmetricKeyClient(user)¶

Delete the symmetric key of the conversation with the passed user

Parameters:user (String) – the user relative to the symmetric key
saveParameters(g, p, path)¶

Save the diffie-hellman public parameters g and p in a json file, these can be reused more than once

Parameters:
  • g (Int) – the parameter g of diffie-hellman
  • p (Int) – the parameter p of diffie-hellman
  • path (String) – the path of the file where the parameters will be saved
Return type:

Boolean
Returns:

True if the save was done succesfully, False if it was not
savePrivateKey(path)¶

Save the Private Key of the client in a file in the specified param path

Parameters:path (String) – The specific path of the file where the key must be saved
Return type:Boolean
Returns:True if the key has been saved, otherwise False
